these are seven (7) common crypto scam and mistakes to never make in 2025 and ways  to protect yourself.

1. Phishing Scams These scams usually arrive in your email or direct messages, making you to believe there  from trusted exchanges like Binance or Coinbase. Theyâ€™ll make you to click a link and enter your login info. Always double-check URLs and never click suspicious links if possible activate anti-phishing code, available on binance, crypto.com, bybit etc .

2. Fake Giveaways On social media, scammers pretend to be celebrities or big crypto influencers promising to double your crypto if you send them a small amount first or invest in their platform or buy their memecoin. The truth? Youâ€™ll never get that money back. If it sounds too good to be true, it is, always do your own reserch, do not trust any crypto 100 percent!.

3. Pump and Dump Groups. These groups lure you in with promises of skyrocketing coins for some hours in a very short time. They buy low, hype the coin, making it go up, then dump it after newcomers (like you) invest. Always research a coin before investing and avoid hype-driven decisions or FOMO.

4. Fake Wallets or Exchanges, Scammers often build apps or websites that look just like real crypto wallets or exchanges. Once you transfer your funds, theyâ€™re gone. sometimes they leave fake arbitrage opportunity, making a price a little high, Only download wallets from trusted sources and double-check reviews and app developers.

5. Sending Funds to the Wrong Address Unlike banks, crypto transfers are irreversible. Always copy-paste addresses carefully and double-check every character, scan qr code if available. A small mistake can cost you everything you sent.

6. Investing Without Research (FOMO) Fear of missing out can lead you to invest blindly into tokens just because theyâ€™re trending. Always understand the project behind a coin, read its whitepaper, check the team, and assess long-term potential.

7. Sharing Private Keys or Seed Phrases This is the #1 mistake. Your seed phrase is like your bank PIN and password combined. Never share it not with friends, customer support, or anyone. If someone gets it, they control your wallet and can move everything inside..
Crypto can be life changing in a good way and can also be devastating if you're not careful. Stay skeptical, take your time, and always educate yourself before making a move.

Want to stay safe? Use hardware wallets, always enable two-factor authentication, and follow trustworthy crypto blogs or forums and always do your own reserch. The more informed you are, the harder it is for scammers to trick you!.
